events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a woman asking a congressman about the historic debate at the Supreme Court about Obamacare, wanting to know his expectations. He responds with a slightly rambling tone. He expects the Supreme Court to rule it constitutional but says this is just a guess. He discusses the Interstate Commerce Clause, stating it was intended to deregulate, advocating for insurance sales across state lines. He then expresses a fear that the court won't defend the free market and the original intent of the Interstate Commerce Clause. He concludes that it would be a tragedy if they rule to support the law.
